html: As a proof of his divinity, Jehovah planned his people’s history so that at the end they would experience things they experienced in the beginning, Israel’s past providing a type of the future (Isaiah 44:7 ). In other words, the “end” (’aharit ) is foretold by the “beginning” (re’sit ), end-time events resembling those of ancient times. Just so, as Jehovah “spoke” in the past so he does again; and as what he spoke was fulfilled in the past so it is again (Isaiah 42:9; 45:21; 48:4-8 ). As a case in point, Jehovah foretold the coming of his servant and the deliverance and destruction that would follow (vv 11-13 ).
